text: <@U6A936746> I am considering DataDeps.jl for managing pre-trained model weights. They are hosted in a separate repo from the package w/ git lfs. Came across this line “DataDeps.jl does not provide for versioning of data – you can’t force users to download new copies of your data using DataDeps.”

elements.text: I am considering DataDeps.jl for managing pre-trained model weights. They are hosted in a separate repo from the package w/ git lfs. Came across this line “DataDeps.jl does not provide for versioning of data – you can’t force users to download new copies of your data using DataDeps.”

text:
There are libraries that do versioning in top of DataDeps via including the version in the name.
The most extensive of which is internal to Invenia.
But the basic idea is pretty easy

elements.text:
There are libraries that do versioning in top of DataDeps via including the version in the name.
The most extensive of which is internal to Invenia.
But the basic idea is pretty easy

text:
With that said, if Artifacts work for you then go ahead and use them.
Artifacts are built on some lessons learned from DataDeps.
(And other sources, and their own new good ideas)
